summary: General-purpose tool for variant evaluation (% in dbSNP, genotype concordance, Ti/Tv ratios, and a lot more)

arguments.summary: If true, adds a PG tag to created SAM/BAM/CRAM files.
arguments.name: --add-output-sam-program-record

arguments.summary: If true, adds a command line header line to created VCF files.
arguments.name: --add-output-vcf-command-line

arguments.summary: Fasta file with ancestral alleles
arguments.name: --ancestral-alignments

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable). Defaults to cloudPrefetchBuffer if unset.
arguments.name: --cloud-index-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable).
arguments.name: --cloud-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: Maximum distance for variants to be grouped together
arguments.name: --combine-variants-distance

arguments.summary: Input comparison file(s)
arguments.name: --comparison
arguments.fulltext: The variant file(s) to compare against.

arguments.summary: If true, create a BAM/CRAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM/CRAM file.
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a MD5 digest for any BAM/SAM/CRAM file created
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-md5

arguments.summary: If true, create a VCF index when writing a coordinate-sorted VCF file.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a a MD5 digest any VCF file created.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-md5

arguments.summary: dbSNP file
arguments.name: --dbsnp

arguments.summary: If true, don't cache bam indexes, this will reduce memory requirements but may harm performance if many intervals are specified.  Caching is automatically disabled if there are no intervals specified.
arguments.name: --disable-bam-index-caching

arguments.summary: If specified, do not check the sequence dictionaries from our inputs for compatibility. Use at your own risk!
arguments.name: --disable-sequence-dictionary-validation

arguments.summary: Do not use the standard modules by default (instead, only those that are specified with the -EV option)
arguments.name: --do-not-use-all-standard-modules

arguments.summary: Do not use the standard stratification modules by default (instead, only those that are specified with the -S option)
arguments.name: --do-not-use-all-standard-stratifications

arguments.summary: Input evaluation file(s)
arguments.name: --eval

arguments.summary: One or more specific eval modules to apply to the eval track(s) (in addition to the standard modules, unless -no-ev is specified)
arguments.name: --eval-module
arguments.fulltext: See the -list argument to view available modules.

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals to exclude from processing
arguments.name: --exclude-intervals
arguments.fulltext:
Use this argument to exclude certain parts of the genome from the analysis (like -L, but the opposite).
 This argument can be specified multiple times. You can use samtools-style intervals either explicitly on the
 command line (e.g. -XL 1 or -XL 1:100-200) or by loading in a file containing a list of intervals
 (e.g. -XL myFile.intervals).

arguments.summary: A configuration file to use with the GATK.
arguments.name: --gatk-config-file

arguments.summary: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection
arguments.name: --gcs-max-retries

arguments.summary: Project to bill when accessing "requester pays" buckets. If unset, these buckets cannot be accessed.  User must have storage.buckets.get permission on the bucket being accessed.
arguments.name: --gcs-project-for-requester-pays

arguments.summary: Evaluations that count calls at sites of true variation (e.g., indel calls) will use this argument as their gold standard for comparison
arguments.name: --gold-standard
arguments.fulltext:
Some analyses want to count overlap not with dbSNP (which is in general very open) but
 actually want to itemize their overlap specifically with a set of gold standard sites
 such as HapMap, OMNI, or the gold standard indels.  This argument provides a mechanism
 for communicating which file to use

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: Restrict variant output to sites that start within provided intervals (only applies when an interval is specified)
arguments.name: --ignore-variants-starting-outside-interval
arguments.fulltext:
this option has no effect unless intervals are specified.

This exists to mimic GATK3 interval traversal patterns

arguments.summary: BAM/SAM/CRAM file containing reads
arguments.name: --input

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are excluding.
arguments.name: --interval-exclusion-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -XL. For example, '-XL 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-XL 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Interval merging rule for abutting intervals
arguments.name: --interval-merging-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program merges abutting intervals (i.e. intervals that are directly side-by-side but do not
 actually overlap) into a single continuous interval. However you can change this behavior if you want them to be
 treated as separate intervals instead.

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are including.
arguments.name: --interval-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -L. For example, '-L 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-L 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Set merging approach to use for combining interval inputs
arguments.name: --interval-set-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program will take the UNION of all intervals specified using -L and/or -XL. However, you can
 change this setting for -L, for example if you want to take the INTERSECTION of the sets instead. E.g. to
 perform the analysis only on chromosome 1 exomes, you could specify -L exomes.intervals -L 1 --interval-set-rule
 INTERSECTION. However, it is not possible to modify the merging approach for intervals passed using -XL (they will
 always be merged using UNION).

 Note that if you specify both -L and -XL, the -XL interval set will be subtracted from the -L interval set.

options.summary: Take the union of all intervals
options.name: UNION

options.summary: Take the intersection of intervals (the subset that overlaps all intervals specified)
options.name: INTERSECTION

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate
arguments.name: --intervals

arguments.summary: If provided, modules that track polymorphic sites will not require that a site have AC > 0 when the input eval has genotypes
arguments.name: --keep-ac0

arguments.summary: File containing tribble-readable features describing a known list of copy number variants
arguments.name: --known-cnvs
arguments.fulltext: File containing tribble-readable features containing known CNVs.  For use with VariantSummary table.

arguments.summary: Name of feature bindings containing variant sites that should be treated as known when splitting eval features into known and novel subsets
arguments.name: --knownNames
arguments.fulltext: List of feature tracks to be used for specifying "known" variants other than dbSNP.

arguments.summary: Lenient processing of VCF files
arguments.name: --lenient

arguments.summary: List the available eval modules and exit
arguments.name: --list
arguments.fulltext: Note that the --list argument requires a fully resolved and correct command-line to work.

arguments.summary: Maximum distance for variants to be grouped together
arguments.name: --max-distance

arguments.summary: If non-zero, partitions VCF output into shards, each containing up to the given number of records.
arguments.name: --max-variants-per-shard

arguments.summary: Minimum genotype QUAL score for each trio member required to accept a site as a violation. Default is 50.
arguments.name: --mendelian-violation-qual-threshold

arguments.summary: If provided, all -eval tracks will be merged into a single eval track
arguments.name: --merge-evals
arguments.fulltext:
If true, VariantEval will treat -eval 1 -eval 2 as separate tracks from the same underlying
 variant set, and evaluate the union of the results.  Useful when you want to do -eval chr1.vcf -eval chr2.vcf etc.

arguments.summary: Minimum phasing quality
arguments.name: --min-phase-quality

arguments.summary: File to which variants should be written
arguments.name: --output

arguments.summary: Pedigree file for determining the population "founders"
arguments.name: --pedigree

arguments.summary: The strictness for validating the pedigree.  Can be either STRICT or SILENT.  Default is STRICT
arguments.name: --pedigreeValidationType

options.summary:
Require if a pedigree file is provided at all samples in the VCF or BAM files have a corresponding
 entry in the pedigree file(s).
options.name: STRICT

options.summary: Do not enforce any overlap between the VCF/BAM samples and the pedigree data
options.name: SILENT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Indices to use for the read inputs. If specified, an index must be provided for every read input and in the same order as the read inputs. If this argument is not specified, the path to the index for each input will be inferred automatically.
arguments.name: --read-index

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM/BAM/CRAM/SRA files read by this program.  The default stringency value SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --read-validation-stringency

arguments.summary: Number of bases on either side to expand spanning reference window
arguments.name: --ref-padding

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file
arguments.name: --reference

arguments.summary: If provided only comp and eval tracks with exactly matching reference and alternate alleles will be counted as overlapping
arguments.name: --require-strict-allele-match

arguments.summary: Derive eval and comp contexts using only these sample genotypes, when genotypes are available in the original context
arguments.name: --sample

arguments.summary: Per-sample ploidy (number of chromosomes per sample)
arguments.name: --sample-ploidy

arguments.summary: Output traversal statistics every time this many seconds elapse
arguments.name: --seconds-between-progress-updates

arguments.summary: One or more stratifications to use when evaluating the data
arguments.name: --selectExps

arguments.summary: Names to use for the list of stratifications (must be a 1-to-1 mapping)
arguments.name: --selectNames

arguments.summary: Use the given sequence dictionary as the master/canonical sequence dictionary.  Must be a .dict file.
arguments.name: --sequence-dictionary

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: If true, don't emit genotype fields when writing vcf file output.
arguments.name: --sites-only-vcf-output

arguments.summary: File containing tribble-readable features for the IntervalStratificiation
arguments.name: --strat-intervals
arguments.fulltext: File containing tribble-readable features for the IntervalStratificiation

arguments.summary: One or more specific stratification modules to apply to the eval track(s) (in addition to the standard stratifications, unless -noS is specified)
arguments.name: --stratification-module

arguments.summary: Temp directory to use.
arguments.name: --tmp-dir

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-deflater

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-inflater

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --verbosity

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Given a variant callset, it is common to calculate various quality control metrics. These metrics include the number of raw or filtered SNP counts; ratio of transition mutations to transversions; concordance of a particular sample's calls to a genotyping chip; number of s per sample; etc. Furthermore, it is often useful to stratify these metrics by various criteria like functional class (missense, nonsense, silent), whether the site is CpG site, the amino acid degeneracy of the site, etc. VariantEval facilitates these calculations in two ways: by providing several built-in evaluation and stratification modules, and by providing a framework that permits the easy development of new evaluation and stratification modules.

Input

One or more variant sets to evaluate plus any number of comparison sets.

Output

Evaluation tables detailing the results of the eval modules which were applied. For example: 

 output.eval.grp:
 ##:GATKReport.v0.1 CountVariants : Counts different classes of variants in the sample
 CountVariants  CompFeatureInput  CpG      EvalFeatureInput  JexlExpression  Novelty  nProcessedLoci  nCalledLoci  nRefLoci  nVariantLoci  variantRate ...
 CountVariants  dbsnp             CpG      eval              none            all      65900028        135770       0         135770        0.00206024  ...
 CountVariants  dbsnp             CpG      eval              none            known    65900028        47068        0         47068         0.00071423  ...
 CountVariants  dbsnp             CpG      eval              none            novel    65900028        88702        0         88702         0.00134601  ...
 CountVariants  dbsnp             all      eval              none            all      65900028        330818       0         330818        0.00502000  ...
 CountVariants  dbsnp             all      eval              none            known    65900028        120685       0         120685        0.00183133  ...
 CountVariants  dbsnp             all      eval              none            novel    65900028        210133       0         210133        0.00318866  ...
 CountVariants  dbsnp             non_CpG  eval              none            all      65900028        195048       0         195048        0.00295976  ...
 CountVariants  dbsnp             non_CpG  eval              none            known    65900028        73617        0         73617         0.00111710  ...
 CountVariants  dbsnp             non_CpG  eval              none            novel    65900028        121431       0         121431        0.00184265  ...
 ...

Usage examples

 gatk VariantEval \
   -R reference.fasta \
   -O output.eval.grp \
   --eval set1:set1.vcf \
   --eval set2:set2.vcf \
   [--comp comp.vcf]
Count Mendelian violations for each family in a callset with multiple families (and provided pedigree) 
 gatk VariantEval \
   -R reference.fasta \
   -O output.MVs.byFamily.table \
   --eval multiFamilyCallset.vcf \
   -no-ev -noST \
   -ST Family \
   -EV MendelianViolationEvaluator

Caveat

Some stratifications and evaluators are incompatible with each other due to their respective memory requirements, such as AlleleCount and VariantSummary, or Sample and VariantSummary. If you specify such a combination, the program will output an error message and ask you to disable one of these options. We do not currently provide an exhaustive list of incompatible combinations, so we recommend trying out combinations that you are interested in on a dummy command line, to rapidly ascertain whether it will work or not.
name: VariantEval
